jx.jx_en_mean: start to defend or support someone or something strongly

lj.lj_ly: there was no one else to &B{take up the cudgels on their behalf}.
lj.lj_ls: 没有其他人去捍卫他们的利益。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English cycgel, of unknown origin

entry.def: A cudgel is a thick, short stick that is used as a weapon.
If you take up the cudgels for someone or something, you speak or fight in support of them.

example.ex: The trade unions took up the cudgels for the 367 staff made redundant.
example.tran: 工会极力支持被裁的367名员工。

means.word_mean: 1. a club that is used as a weapon
